00001 package com.placesandplaces;
00002 
00003 //code source: http://theoryapp.com/dynamic-array-class-in-java/
00004 
00005 import java.util.Arrays;
00006 
00007 public class DynamicArrays {
00008         // The storage for the elements.
00009         // The capacity is the length of this array.
00010         private Place[] data;
00011 
00012         // The number of elements (logical size).
00013         // It must be smaller than the capacity.
00014         private int size;
00015 
00016         // Constructs an empty DynamicArray
00017         public DynamicArrays() {
00018                 data = new Place[100];
00019                 size = 0;
00020         }
00021 
00022         // Constructs an empty DynamicArray with the
00023         // specified initial capacity.
00024         public DynamicArrays(int capacity) {
00025                 if (capacity < 100)
00026                         capacity = 100;
00027                 data = new Place[capacity];
00028                 size = 0;
00029         }
00030 
00031         // Returns the logical size
00032         public int size() {
00033                 return size;
00034         }
00035 
00036         public boolean isEmpty() {
00037                 return size == 0;
00038         }
00039 
00040         // Checks if the given index is in range.
00041         private void rangeCheck(int index) {
00042                 if (index >= size || index < 0)
00043                         throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Index: " + index + ", Size: "
00044                                         + size);
00045         }
00046 
00047         // Returns the element at the specified position.
00048         public Place get(int index) {
00049                 rangeCheck(index);
00050                 return data[index];
00051         }
00052 
00053         // Appends the specified element to the end.
00054         public boolean add(Place element) {
00055                 // ensureCapacity(size + 1);
00056                 data[size++] = element;
00057                 return true;
00058         }
00059 
00060         // Removes all of the elements.
00061         public void clear() {
00062                 size = 0;
00063         }
00064 
00065         // Replaces the element at the specified position
00066         public Place set(int index, Place element) {
00067                 rangeCheck(index);
00068                 Place oldValue = data[index];
00069                 data[index] = element;
00070                 return oldValue;
00071         }
00072 
00073         public int capacity() {
00074                 return data.length;
00075         }
00076 }
